poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
The arteries are clogged, the cord is taut. What once in clover coiled, now clawed its way Through cogged procedure and slyly claused protocol.
In the ringing quad he'd conned Vocabulary, coined the odd mistake And called it art. The clod.
Many are called But few are frozen cod, And they don't crow.
What caused him to smart was the hushed Chord of a lover's voice.
